title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine (PS3)
author: You
excerpt: Visceral, fast, and gloriously messy—Wolverine’s acrobatic move set and ‘Fury’ attacks deliver the comic’s feral brutality. Technical hiccups aside, it’s a blood-soaked cult classic.
body: # Overview
Wolverine on PS3 hits harder than you'd expect from a movie tie-in. Fluid combos and grisly finishers keep the pace brisk.
## Combat feel
Light/heavy chains snap together cleanly. Bosses are a touch spongey but not dull.
## Low points
Recycled arenas, some camera quirks. Story mirrors the film.
## Verdict
It's not God of War, but it has claws—literally and mechanically.

title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon (PS2)
author: You
excerpt: One-shot kills, no regen, and open-ended objectives forge a gritty, consequence-heavy campaign. Not for everyone—but for tactics fans, it’s a landmark with bite.
body: # Overview
On PS2, Ghost Recon brought tactical realism to consoles, trading flash for deliberate squad-based play.
## Tactical gameplay
Managing fields of fire and coordinating AI teammates mattered more than twitch reflexes.
## Low points
Graphics and controls felt clunky by comparison with flashier shooters.
## Verdict
Not for everyone, but a milestone in tactical realism on console.

title: Resistance 3 (PS3)
author: You
excerpt: Resistance 3 rebuilds the series’ reputation with a focused story, a glorious weapon wheel, and smart enemy design. Shorter, tighter, and more human—an underrated finale that’s simply a joy to play.
body: # Overview
Resistance 3 shifts to a more personal story with a grounded, desperate tone and strong atmosphere.
## Weapons
Insomniac's trademark creativity shines — from mutant-incinerating flamethrowers to inventive alt-fires.
## Low points
Occasional pacing dips and uneven difficulty spikes.
## Verdict
A fitting, underrated finale to the Resistance trilogy that still stands out today.
